issue.title: Low frame rates on sensors with 1.8.6/2.6.5

content.html:
@faller : You're right that it's easy to change sensor update rates in the URDF to slow down some cameras in deference to the laser. But for all we know, other teams are counting on high update rates from those cameras. In this case, where there's no free lunch, we have to be conservative and leave the system how it's been since the start of practice.

You've surely already thought of this, but: a workaround is to actively manage your subscriptions to sensors that use the GPU. E.g., in general only subscribe to cameras when you need them, and specifically when you need high-rate data from the laser, unsubscribe from cameras that you don't strictly need.

Down the road, it would be good to support subscriber-configurable sensor update rates to allow users to make these tradeoffs more easily at runtime.
